meanings.definition: To restore to a state of readiness or effectiveness.
meanings.sent1: After repairs, the mechanic will recommission the car for use.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to recommission the old equipment for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The superhero recommissioned his powers just in time to save the day.
meanings.sent4: The artist recommissioned the painting, bringing it back to life with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to recommission the oven to bake the perfect cake.

meanings.definition: To appoint or assign again to a position or duty.
meanings.sent1: The company will recommission the employee to lead the new project.
meanings.sent2: The general decided to recommission the soldier for another mission.
meanings.sent3: The mayor jokingly recommissioned the town clown as the official entertainer.
meanings.sent4: The coach recommissioned the star player, hoping for a victory in the game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to recommission the student as the class monitor due to his responsible nature.
